title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing othersâ€™ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement [conduct@tradingverse.org] opening issue. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired Mozillaâ€™s code conduct enforcement ladder. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

code: library(tradeio) library(dplyr)  # Fetch FAANG stocks faang <- fetch_prices(   c("META", "AAPL", "AMZN", "NFLX", "GOOGL"),   from = "2024-01-01" )  # Calculate returns returns <- faang |>   group_by(symbol) |>   mutate(return = (close / first(close) - 1) * 100) |>   summarise(total_return = last(return))  print(returns)

title: ğŸ‰ tradeio v0.1.0 - COMPLETE!
code: # Fetch major cryptocurrencies crypto <- fetch_prices(   c("BTC-USD", "ETH-USD", "BNB-USD"),   from = "2024-01-01" )  # Calculate volatility volatility <- crypto |>   group_by(symbol) |>   mutate(daily_return = (close / lag(close) - 1)) |>   summarise(volatility = sd(daily_return, na.rm = TRUE) * 100)  print(volatility)

code: # Fetch Apple stock data aapl <- fetch_prices("AAPL", from = "2024-01-01")  # View the data head(aapl) # A tibble: 6 Ã— 8   symbol datetime              open  high   low close   volume adjusted   <chr>  <dttm>               <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>    <dbl>    <dbl> 1 AAPL   2024-01-02 09:30:00   184.  186.  183.  185. 70134200     185. 2 AAPL   2024-01-03 09:30:00   185.  186.  183.  184. 58216400     184. 3 AAPL   2024-01-04 09:30:00   183.  184.  181.  181. 64512300     181. ...

title: Security Policy
text: release patches security vulnerabilities following versions:

title: Security Policy
text: take security TradingVerse seriously. discover security vulnerability, please follow steps:

what: 1. Do Not Open a Public Issue
title: Security Policy
text: Please open public GitHub issue security vulnerabilities. helps prevent vulnerability exploited fix available.

title: Security Policy
text: Report security vulnerabilities via one methods: Email: security@tradingverse.org (preferred) GitHub Security Advisory: Use â€œReport vulnerabilityâ€ button Security tab Direct Message: Contact maintainer directly

title: Security Policy
text: Please include: Description vulnerability Steps reproduce issue Potential impact suggested fixes (optional) contact information follow-

title: Security Policy
text: Acknowledgment: Within 48 hours Initial Assessment: Within 1 week Critical: Within 7 days High: Within 30 days Medium: Within 90 days Low: Next regular release

title: Security Policy
text: work understand resolve issue notify affected users fix available credit security advisory (unless prefer remain anonymous) follow responsible disclosure practices

title: Security Policy
text: TradingVerse primarily designed educational research purposes. using production trading environments: API Keys: Never commit API keys credentials repository Data Privacy: cautious sensitive trading data Financial Risk: Understand bugs result financial losses Testing: Thoroughly test strategies paper trading live deployment Compliance: Ensure compliance relevant financial regulations

title: Security Policy
text: Use environment variables sensitive data Regularly update dependencies Review code deploying production Use secure connections (HTTPS) data fetching Implement proper error handling logging Follow principle least privilege

title: Security Policy
text: Past security advisories published : https://github.com/Traderverse/tradingverse/security/advisories

title: Security Policy
text: questions security policy, please open discussion GitHub Discussions forum contact us security@tradingverse.org. Remember: open-source software provided â€œâ€ without warranty. Users responsible trading decisions risk management.

title: Authors and Citation
text: TradingVerse Core Team. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Core Team T (2025). tradeio: Data Acquisition Normalization TradingVerse. R package version 0.1.0, https://github.com/tradingverse/tradeio.
code: @Manual{,   title = {tradeio: Data Acquisition and Normalization for TradingVerse},   author = {TradingVerse {Core Team}},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://github.com/tradingverse/tradeio}, }

what: tradeio â€¢ Data Acquisition for R
title: tradeio â€¢ Data Acquisition for R
text: Data Acquisition Normalization TradingVerse tradeio data ingestion layer TradingVerse ecosystem. provides unified, pipe-friendly interface fetching financial market data multiple sources automatically converts standardized market_tbl format.

title: tradeio â€¢ Data Acquisition for R
text: ğŸŒ Multi-Source Support: Yahoo Finance, Alpha Vantage, FRED, CSV files ğŸ”„ Automatic Normalization: data converted consistent market_tbl format ğŸ• Timezone Management: Proper handling market timezones ğŸ“Š Corporate Actions: Automatic adjustment splits dividends ğŸ” Missing Data Handling: Forward-fill, backward-fill, interpolation âœ… Data Validation: Ensures OHLC consistency data quality ğŸš€ Tidy-Friendly: Works seamlessly dplyr pipes

title: tradeio â€¢ Data Acquisition for R
code: # Install from GitHub devtools::install_github("tradingverse/tradeio")  # Or install entire TradingVerse devtools::install_github("tradingverse/tradingverse")

title: tradeio â€¢ Data Acquisition for R
code: library(tradeio) library(dplyr)  # Fetch stock prices from Yahoo Finance aapl <- fetch_prices("AAPL", from = "2024-01-01", to = "2024-12-31")  # Multiple stocks at once tech_stocks <- fetch_prices(   c("AAPL", "MSFT", "GOOGL", "NVDA"),   from = "2024-01-01" )  # Works with pipes prices <- c("AAPL", "TSLA") |>   fetch_prices(from = "2023-01-01") |>   fill_missing_data(method = "forward") |>   adjust_for_splits()

title: tradeio â€¢ Data Acquisition for R
code: # Universal fetch function (auto-detects source) fetch_prices(tickers, from, to, source = "yahoo")  # Source-specific functions fetch_yahoo(tickers, from, to, auto_adjust = TRUE) fetch_alpha_vantage(tickers, api_key, interval = "daily") fetch_csv(file_path, symbol_column = "symbol")

title: tradeio â€¢ Data Acquisition for R
code: # Handle missing data fill_missing_data(data, method = "forward")  # or "backward", "linear", "spline"  # Adjust for corporate actions adjust_for_splits(data) adjust_for_dividends(data)  # Timezone conversion set_timezone(data, tz = "America/New_York")  # Validate data quality validate_market_data(data)

title: tradeio â€¢ Data Acquisition for R
code: # Standardize ticker symbols across sources normalize_tickers(c("AAPL", "MSFT", "BTC-USD"))

title: tradeio â€¢ Data Acquisition for R
text: functions return data standardized market_tbl format:

title: tradeio â€¢ Data Acquisition for R
code: attr(data, "frequency")    # "daily", "1hour", "1min", etc. attr(data, "timezone")     # "America/New_York", "UTC", etc. attr(data, "asset_class")  # "equity", "crypto", "futures", "fx" attr(data, "source")       # "yahoo", "alpha_vantage", etc.

title: tradeio â€¢ Data Acquisition for R
text: tradeio designed work seamlessly TradingVerse packages:
code: library(tradeio) library(tradefeatures) library(tradeengine)  # Complete workflow strategy_results <-    # 1. Fetch data   fetch_prices("AAPL", from = "2023-01-01") |>      # 2. Add features (tradefeatures)   add_sma(20) |>   add_rsi(14) |>      # 3. Backtest (tradeengine)   add_strategy(     entry = rsi < 30,     exit = rsi > 70   ) |>   backtest(initial_capital = 10000)

title: tradeio â€¢ Data Acquisition for R
text: Free: API key required Coverage: Stocks, ETFs, indices, crypto, futures History: 50+ years major stocks Limitations: Rate limited, occasional data gaps
code: prices <- fetch_yahoo("AAPL", from = "2020-01-01")

title: tradeio â€¢ Data Acquisition for R
text: API Key: Required (free tier available) Coverage: Stocks, forex, crypto, economic indicators Features: Real-time data, technical indicators Limitations: 5 calls/minute free tier
code: prices <- fetch_alpha_vantage(   "AAPL",   api_key = Sys.getenv("ALPHA_VANTAGE_KEY"),   interval = "daily" )

title: tradeio â€¢ Data Acquisition for R
text: Format: Custom CSV standard OHLCV format Use Case: Proprietary data, offline backtesting
code: prices <- fetch_csv(   "data/custom_prices.csv",   symbol_column = "ticker",   date_column = "date" )

title: tradeio â€¢ Data Acquisition for R
code: # Fetch multiple assets across different classes portfolio <- fetch_prices(   c("AAPL", "MSFT", "BTC-USD", "GC=F", "EURUSD=X"),   from = "2024-01-01" )

title: tradeio â€¢ Data Acquisition for R
text: can extend tradeio custom data sources:
code: # Register custom data source register_data_source(   name = "custom_api",   fetch_fn = function(ticker, from, to) {     # Your custom fetching logic     # Must return market_tbl format   } )  # Use it prices <- fetch_prices("TICKER", source = "custom_api")

title: tradeio â€¢ Data Acquisition for R
code: # Enable caching to avoid repeated API calls options(tradeio.cache = TRUE) options(tradeio.cache_dir = "~/.tradeio_cache")  # Cached data will be reused prices <- fetch_prices("AAPL", from = "2020-01-01")

title: tradeio â€¢ Data Acquisition for R
code: library(tradeio) library(dplyr) library(ggplot2)  tech_stocks <- fetch_prices(   c("AAPL", "MSFT", "GOOGL", "AMZN", "META"),   from = "2024-01-01" )  # Calculate returns tech_returns <- tech_stocks |>   group_by(symbol) |>   mutate(return = (close / first(close) - 1) * 100)  # Plot ggplot(tech_returns, aes(x = datetime, y = return, color = symbol)) +   geom_line() +   labs(title = "Tech Stock Returns 2024", y = "Return (%)")

title: tradeio â€¢ Data Acquisition for R
code: # Fetch Bitcoin and Ethereum crypto <- fetch_prices(   c("BTC-USD", "ETH-USD"),   from = "2023-01-01" )  # Calculate correlation crypto |>   select(symbol, datetime, close) |>   pivot_wider(names_from = symbol, values_from = close) |>   select(-datetime) |>   cor(use = "complete.obs")

title: tradeio â€¢ Data Acquisition for R
code: # Fetch data with potential gaps prices <- fetch_prices("THINLY_TRADED_STOCK", from = "2024-01-01")  # Fill gaps using different methods prices_ffill <- fill_missing_data(prices, method = "forward") prices_linear <- fill_missing_data(prices, method = "linear") prices_spline <- fill_missing_data(prices, method = "spline")

what: Fetch Data from Alpha Vantage API â€” fetch_alpha_vantage

code: fetch_alpha_vantage(   tickers,   api_key = Sys.getenv("ALPHA_VANTAGE_KEY"),   interval = "daily",   outputsize = "compact" )

title: Fetch Data from Alpha Vantage API â€” fetch_alpha_vantage
text: tickers Character vector: ticker symbols api_key Character: Alpha Vantage API key (set ALPHA_VANTAGE_KEY env var) interval Character: "daily", "weekly", "monthly", "1min", "5min", "15min", "30min", "60min" outputsize Character: "compact" (100 data points) "full" (20+ years)

title: Fetch Data from Alpha Vantage API â€” fetch_alpha_vantage
text: market_tbl object

title: Load Market Data from CSV File â€” fetch_csv
text: file_path Character: path CSV file symbol_column Character: name symbol column (default: "symbol") date_column Character: name date/datetime column (default: "date") symbol Character: CSV symbol column, specify symbol ... Additional arguments passed readr::read_csv()

title: Load Market Data from CSV File â€” fetch_csv
text: market_tbl object

title: Load Market Data from CSV File â€” fetch_csv
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Load from CSV data <- fetch_csv("my_data.csv")  # Specify column names data <- fetch_csv(   "my_data.csv",   symbol_column = "ticker",   date_column = "datetime" )  # Single symbol file without symbol column data <- fetch_csv("aapl.csv", symbol = "AAPL") } # }

what: Fetch Market Prices from Multiple Sources â€” fetch_prices
title: Fetch Market Prices from Multiple Sources â€” fetch_prices
text: Universal function fetch OHLCV market data various sources. Automatically detects best source returns normalized market_tbl data.

title: Fetch Market Prices from Multiple Sources â€” fetch_prices
code: fetch_prices(   tickers,   from = Sys.Date() - 365,   to = Sys.Date(),   source = "yahoo",   interval = "daily",   auto_adjust = TRUE,   api_key = NULL,   ... )

title: Fetch Market Prices from Multiple Sources â€” fetch_prices
text: tickers Character vector: one ticker symbols (e.g., "AAPL", "BTC-USD") Date character: start date (default: 1 year ago) Date character: end date (default: today) source Character: data source - "yahoo" (default), "alpha_vantage", custom interval Character: time interval - "daily", "1hour", "1min", etc. (default: "daily") auto_adjust Logical: automatically adjust splits/dividends (default: TRUE) api_key Character: API key sources require (e.g., Alpha Vantage) ... Additional arguments passed source-specific functions

title: Fetch Market Prices from Multiple Sources â€” fetch_prices
text: market_tbl object columns: symbol, datetime, open, high, low, close, volume, adjusted

title: Fetch Market Prices from Multiple Sources â€” fetch_prices
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Fetch single stock aapl <- fetch_prices("AAPL", from = "2024-01-01")  # Multiple stocks tech <- fetch_prices(c("AAPL", "MSFT", "GOOGL"), from = "2023-01-01")  # Cryptocurrency btc <- fetch_prices("BTC-USD", from = "2024-01-01")  # Using Alpha Vantage prices <- fetch_prices(   "AAPL",   source = "alpha_vantage",   api_key = Sys.getenv("ALPHA_VANTAGE_KEY") ) } # }

title: Fill Missing Data â€” fill_missing_data

title: Fill Missing Data â€” fill_missing_data
text: data market_tbl object method Character: "forward" (last observation carried forward), "backward" (next observation carried backward), "linear" (linear interpolation), "spline" (spline interpolation) columns Character vector: columns fill (default: numeric columns)

title: Fill Missing Data â€” fill_missing_data
text: market_tbl filled values

code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ data <- fetch_prices("AAPL", from = "2024-01-01")  # Forward fill filled <- fill_missing_data(data, method = "forward")  # Linear interpolation filled <- fill_missing_data(data, method = "linear") } # }

title: Validate Market Data â€” validate_market_data
